N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 142.3 - Applications for geographic area pay differentials

State Regulations

An application for a geographic area pay differential may be
filed by an employee, employee representative or appointing officer. Such
application shall be submitted on a form prescribed by the Director of

Classification and Compensation, which shall require, but not be limited to, the following information: (a) the
official title of the occupation or occupations for which the differential is
requested; (b) a delineation of the
area or location for which the differential is requested; (c) the amount of the differential
requested; (d) factual salary data
of such a nature as to reasonably support the assertion that salaries paid for
the occupation or occupations in the area or areas for which the geographic
area pay differential is requested, in private or other nonstate employment, substantially exceed salaries paid by the State and salaries in private or
other nonstate employment for the same or similar occupation or occupations
generally in the State; and
(e) such other pertinent information as may be required by the Director of

Classification and Compensation. Notes
